intro: Dryadella melloi, commonly known as the Mello's dryad, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are finely divided and often covered in a thin layer of fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in its arid environment. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
